original: Naajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an internal states as condition, an internal states arises, a root-cause condition … three.

original: Nabāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabāhiro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bāhiram dhammam paṭicca na bāhiraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paṭicca ajjhattikam
translated: With an external states as condition, an external states arises, a root-cause condition: at the consciousness-moment of rebirth-linking, with the mind as condition there arises materiality acquired through kamma. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe pañca …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe pañca pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the case of root-cause condition, there are nine; in the case of object condition, five … in the case of non-hindrance condition, nine. (In each case the method of treatment is to be elaborated as in the case of root-cause condition.)
